content: The Act titled "Montgomery GI Bill Revitalization Act of 2003" enhances benefits under the Montgomery GI Bill for four years of active-duty service. The Montgomery GI Bill Revitalization Act of 2003 introduces enhanced educational assistance entitlement for eligible individuals who meet specific service requirements. The Montgomery GI Bill Revitalization Act of 2003 provides enhanced educational assistance for individuals who enter, reenlist, or extend their enlistment on active duty in the Armed Forces for a minimum of four years. The Montgomery GI Bill Revitalization Act of 2003 offers increased educational benefits for individuals who serve at least 42 months of continuous active duty, with specific rules for determining service periods. The Montgomery GI Bill Revitalization Act of 2003 provides enhanced educational benefits for individuals with at least 42 months of continuous active duty. Eligible individuals can elect to receive basic educational assistance instead of enhanced assistance for an enrollment period, with specific rules for making and revoking this election. The Montgomery GI Bill Revitalization Act of 2003 offers enhanced educational benefits for individuals with 42 months of continuous active duty. Eligible individuals can receive a monthly enhanced educational assistance allowance for up to 36 months. Special rules apply for early separations from the Armed Forces. The Montgomery GI Bill Revitalization Act of 2003 provides enhanced educational benefits for individuals with continuous active duty. Eligible individuals can receive one month of enhanced educational assistance benefits for each month of active duty served, not exceeding 36 months. The Secretary will pay the actual cost of tuition and fees for approved education programs, not exceeding the amount charged to nonveterans. The Secretary will pay eligible individuals a stipend and cover the average cost of books and supplies for approved education programs. Amounts paid by the Secretary under this subchapter are not considered as income for determining eligibility for education grants or federal educational loans. The stipend under this subchapter is paid at varying monthly rates based on the approved program of education pursued. The rates range from $900 for full-time to $300 for less than half-time basis. Adjustments for inflation may apply. The Secretary will adjust the rate paid under subsection (a) for each fiscal year after 2004 based on inflation. Individuals entitled to enhanced educational assistance will receive benefits under section 3019 of this title. SEC. 3. REPEAL OF PAY REDUCTION, ELECTION OF BENEFITS, AND HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATION REQUIREMENT FOR PARTICIPATION IN BASIC EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE UNDER MONTGOMERY GI BILL. This section repeals certain requirements for participation in basic educational assistance under the Montgomery GI Bill. The amendment to Title 38, United States Code, includes provisions to prevent pay reductions for individuals after September 30, 2003, and satisfies obligations under subsection (b) as of that date. Additionally, sections related to active duty program and election of benefits are revised to remove pay reduction provisions for individuals after a certain date. The amendments to Title 38, United States Code prevent pay reductions for individuals after September 30, 2003. Obligations under subsection (b) are deemed satisfied as of that date.
